name: 1.1 - CWP for tunnel excavation & support work
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Conformance Criteria - Approval CWP has been transmitted via InEight
1.2 - ITP for tunnel excavation & support work
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Conformance Criteria - Approval ITP has been transmitted via InEight
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all drawings are approved and transmitted Via InEight with IFC status
Verifying Records - IFC Drawings transmitted into InEight with IFC status
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all relevant Specifications have been approved and transmitted Via InEight with IFC status
Verifying Records - IFC Specification transmitted into InEight with IFC status
Description - No work shall commence until a valid Permit to Tunnel has been signed off for the current section of excavation
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Conformance Criteria - Valid permit to tunnel
Verifying Records - Permit to tunnel signed off by all nominated personnel
Description - The Constructor shall propose a method for a preconstruction trial of the groundwater control system and submit it to the Designer’s Representative for review.
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - Groundwater control system methodology

Description - Where the inflow into the tunnel exceeds 3L/m of length/day averaged over a 100m length of tunnel, appropriate post-installed drainage measures shall be proposed by the Constructor and approved by the Designer’s representative.
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the remedial work
Verifying Records - Post-installation groundwater control system methodology

Description - A preconstruction trial shall be carried out by the Constructor to demonstrate the effectiveness of the connections of strip drains from the top heading to the bench, unless using approved manufacturer's recommended connections installed to the manufacturer's specification.
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - Groundwater control system Trial Results

Description - A pre-construction trial shall be carried out by the constructure to demonstrate that the proposed grout used is able to fully encapsulate the bolt using the proposed installation method
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - The rock reinforcement Trial Results

Description - The Constructor shall conduct a Investigation test (pre-production) on sacrificial rock reinforcements and tested progressively to failure. Investigation load test rock reinforcements are to be installed at locations, agreed with the Designer’s Representative.
○ The Constructor shall notify the Designer’s Representative with a minimum of 48 hour notice.

Test frequency - Prior to the commencement with A minimum of six investigation tests shall be carried out for each type of rock, grout mix, and rock bolt or dowel orientation, or as agreed upon with the Designer’s Representative.
Conformance Criteria - At the end of the third Load Cycle the bolt shall be incrementally loaded at intervals of not greater than 33% of Proof Load

Description - The Constructor shall conduct end anchorage test with a minimum of six rock bolts per proposed rock reinforcement system shall be tested in each ground type. For acceptance of end anchorage, all individual bolts shall achieve the pre-tension load shown on the Drawings.
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement with A minimum of six tests shall be carried out in each ground type.
Conformance Criteria - All individual bolts shall achieve the pre-tension load shown on the Drawings.
Verifying Records - End Anchorage test results
Description - Details of all equipment to be approved by the designers representative
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Verifying Records - Equipment Technical Data Sheets
Description - A trial shall be carried out in advance of tunnelling activities to identify optimum drill bit, drill diameter and flushing and percussion rates
Test frequency - Prior to start of tunnelling
Verifying Records - Probe hole trial result
Description - Compliance with Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 4
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Conformance Criteria - as per Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 4
Description - Type and dosage of shotcrete accelerator shall conform to the requirements of the Specification
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - Nozzelman shall hold a verification of competence (VOC) issued by the constructor
Conformance Criteria - Ensure only personnel hodling VOC are operating the shotcrete robot on site.
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - rockbolts material and corrosion protection
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Conformance Criteria - Grade 500N, galvanised HDG to AS/NZS 4680 Material Approval Record including mill certificate
Description - glass fibre reinforced face dowels material
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - Inspect fabricated rock bolts and rock dowels prior to installation
Verifying Records - Delivery Docket/Mil Test cert
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - Visual confirmation of delivered items
Verifying Records - Delivery Docket/Mil Test cert
2.5. Cement grout for rock bolts, dowels, spiles
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - Visual confirmation of delivered items
Test frequency - Prior to the commencement of the excavation work
Description - Visual confirmation of delivered items
Conformance Criteria - As per accepted MAR
Description - Compliance with Technical Specification C0660 - Tunnel Convergence Monitoring
Description - PTT shall define the planned excavation limits and support types (RESS) prior to each defined period of excavation in each heading or bench face.
○ Tunnel excavation shall not commence on a shift until PTT has been signed off
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Description - Recommend the required support type based on the Actual Ground Conditions.
○ Determine any corrective measures required to ensure safety and stability of the excavation.
○ Identify if the ground conditions depart from the expected range of conditions for which a support type has been designed and notify the Designer if new design is required.
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Verifying Records - Required Excavation and support sheet
Description - Control the E-Line before, during and after excavation is finished
Method/Description - Surveyor to set out and record as built. VMT system to provide e-line guidance
Description - Check delivery docket to ensure the mix used is the correct mix
Test frequency - Prior to any shotcrete application
Description - Prepare all surfaces to be shotcreted prior to application of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Surface clean and free of loose material, pre-wet surface immediately prior to spraying.
○ Any residual flowing or seeping water shall be controlled using channels, chases, pipes, or other approved means.
Description - Prepare all surfaces to be shotcreted prior to application of shotcrete

Conformance Criteria - Surface clean and free of loose material, loose shotcrete rebound removed. Pre-wet surface immediately prior to spraying. Spalled, cracked, loose or contaminated shotcrete removed.
Description - Check the temperature of the shotcrete is within acceptable range between 5°C and 35°C.
○ The ambient temperature shoule be more than or equal 5ᴼC.
Test frequency - Each mixer truck prior to discharging
Verifying Records - Shotcrete Installation Record refer to Item 3.2
Description - Slump to be within the alocated tolerance
Test frequency - Each delivery truck prior to discharging
Description - Test prior to each personnel entry and/or face advance.
○ Test results must be verified once a month during construction.
Test frequency - Initially test prior to each personnel entry after spraying primary shotcrete. Once established, this curve must be verified once a month during construction.
Conformance Criteria - Min 1MPa for man entry (providing the shotcrete layer is 75mm thick, rockbolts have been installed and the rockbolt grout compressive strength is min 3MPa)
Verifying Records - Penetrometer test results refer to Item 3.3
3.2.7. - Beam End Test (early age compressive strength)
Description - Safe shotcrete strength before next advancement to max. advance length
Test frequency - Initially test prior to each personnel entry after spraying primary shotcrete. Once established, this curve must be verified once a month during construction.
Conformance Criteria - Min. 1.00 MPa at 3 Hours
Verifying Records - Beam End Test Results refer to Item 3.3
Description - To prove compressive strength compliance requirement
Test frequency - 1 test (I test shall include 4 cored specimen, 3 tested and 1 spare) for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Min. 35 MPa at 28 days
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compressive strength compliance requirement
Test frequency - 1 test for every 50m3 of sprayed shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Min. 20 MPa at 7 days
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with flexural strength requirements
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 100m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Min. FR,1 of 1.25MPa and FR,4 at 1MPa
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with shrinkage requirements
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - to prove compliance with permeability requirements
Test frequency - 3 tests for the first 50m3 of shotcrete then 1 test every 1 month thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with fibre content test requirement
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 100m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - To prove compliance with the relative density requirement
Test frequency - 1 test for the first 50m3 of shotcrete and 1 test for every 250m3 of shotcrete thereafter
Conformance Criteria - Minimum 98% of the density measured from base mix
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
3.2.15. - Layer thickness, Tunnel Lining Intrados, C-Line
Description - Provide control means to verify the thickness of final shotcrete layer
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8130 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8119

Description - Construction joints in the shotcrete lining top heading/bench shall be inspected by the Designer’s
Representative as required by the Drawings.
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Verifying Records - Site Inspection Report, Shotcrete Checklist
Description - Curing to be carried out in accordance with the Specification
Description - The final layer of shotcrete shall be inspected for any defects and repaired accordingly.

○ At the completion of the lining, all core holes in the lining (resulting from testing or inspection) shall be backfilled with non-shrink mortar of an equivalent strength and fire resistance properties unless otherwise specified. The surface of the restored hole shall be similar to the surrounding surface in texture and colour.
Test frequency - Every defect on Every advance
Verifying Records - Post spray inspection record
Description - To prove position, cover and overlap are achieved
Conformance Criteria - Longitudinal and transverse overlap of 250mm (one mesh square plus 50mm)
○ Min. cover 65mm at the extrados and 85mm at the intrados
Description - Bolts shall be installed to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
Conformance Criteria - Rockbolts shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.
– The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered.
Description - Record all information on installation (position, hole length and dianeterm length of the bolt…)
Conformance Criteria - Rockbolts to be clean and free from rust or any other physical damage at the time of installation
○ Type of bolts, diameter, length, location, spacing and orientation according to detailed design
○ The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered.
Test frequency - Every batch prior to grouting
Conformance Criteria - Target w/c ratio as per MAR
Description - Testing specimen to measure UCS
Test frequency - Evevery batch prior to grouting (three cubes at 1 day, three cubes at 28 days)
The average compressive strength determined from any group of cubes shall exceed the specified characterisitc strength by:
Description - To ensure correct practice and full encapsulation

Conformance Criteria - Sufficient number of resin cartridges to be used with each rock reinforcement installation in accordance with the approved project specific procedure developed during the trials.
○ daily records of all grouting works to be kept
Description - Demonstrate that the installed rock reinforcements can provide at least the design working load capacity.
Test frequency - 1. First three installations of both rock bolts and rock dowels in each ground type as present in production.
○ 2. 5% of the next 100 installations of rock bolts and rock dowels, proportionately throughout the ground types presenting.
○ 3. 2.5% of the remaining bolts and dowels proportionately throughout the ground types presenting

○ Note: 3 neighbouring installations of rock reinforcement surrounding a failed rock bolt or dowel test (and test frequency to revert back to 5% for the next 100 and 2.5% for the remaining installations)

Conformance Criteria - The bolt or dowel is deemed acceptable if, during the cycle, the displacement of the bolt or dowel head relative to the measuring datum (after allowing for any temperature changes) does not exceed the criteria for 100% of the working load, as set out in Table 6.4 of the specification.
○ Failure criteria: 2% Maximum Permissible Displacement or failure to maintain specified loads or ongoing creep of the rock bolt or rock dowel
Description - Spiles shall be installed to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
Conformance Criteria - Positional tolerance of portal spile bars not to exceed 25mm in any direction
○ Setout angle shall be as per drawing. Max. angular tolerance not to exceed 1 in 60.
Conformance Criteria - Spiles shall be free of dirt, detrimental rust or any other deleterious substance.
○ Type of spile, diameter, length, location, spacing and orientation according to detailed design.
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record
Description - To ensure correct practice and w/c ratio check
Test frequency - Every batch prior to grouting
Conformance Criteria - Target w/c ratio as per MAR
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record
Description - Testing specimen to measure UCS
Test frequency - Evevery batch prior to grouting (three cubes at 1 day, three cubes at 28 days)
The average compressive strength determined from any group of cubes shall excess the specified characterisitc strength by:
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
Description - Dowels shall be drilled to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
Conformance Criteria - Dowels shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.
–The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered.
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record/Check list /As built Survey
Description - Dowels shall be installed to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
Conformance Criteria - dowels to be clean or any other physical damage at the time of installation
○ Type of bolts, diameter, length, location, spacing and orientation according to detailed design
○ The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered.
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record
Description - To ensure correct practice and w/c ratio check
Test frequency - Every batch prior to grouting
Conformance Criteria - Target w/c ratio as per MAR
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record
Description - Testing specimen to measure UCS
Test frequency - Every batch prior to grouting (three cubes at 1 day, three cubes at 28 days)
Conformance Criteria - min 20MPa at 1 day, and average to exceed specified strength by 1MPa
○ min 40MPa at 28 days, and average to exceed specified strength
Verifying Records - IANZ lab test report
○ Check the water inflow during and after drilling
Test frequency - Maintain minimum one probe at 20 m ahead of the face at all times
Conformance Criteria - Hole diameter minimum 50 mm

○ Not less than three probe holes shall be maintained a minimum of 6m ahead of the excavation face at all times and with at least 1 probe hole maintained a minimum 20m ahead of the excavation face at all times
Verifying Records - Probe holes record ,Survey As built report
Description - Monitoring and reading records of the tunnel extensometer
Conformance Criteria - Refer to drawings MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8180
Description - Monitoring and reading records on the tunnel optical survey targets
Description - Record location and ensure correct installation
Conformance Criteria - Location and quantity of the strip drains shall be as instructed on site by the Designer's representative
Verifying Records - Excavation and shotcrete check sheet,Survey as built record

Description - Where the inflow into the tunnel exceeds the design criteria,appropriate post-installed drainage measures shall be proposed by the Constructor and approved by the Designer’s representative.
Conformance Criteria - Shall not be exceed 3L/m of length/day averaged over a 100m length of tunnel. Where exceeded, the post-installation groundwater methodology is to be followed.
Description - As-built drawings to capture any deviation from the IFC drawings.
Verifying Records - Red Line Mark Up Drawings
Description - As-built drawings to capture any deviation from the IFC drawings.
Verifying Records - As-built drawings, installation record, as built records, PTT, testing results, monitoring documentation, operation and maintenance report, Producer Statements
Description - Tunnel Operation and maintenance report to detail the maintenance frequency and maintenance procedures.
Verifying Records - Tunnel operation and maintenance report

Description - Collation of all QA, as-built drawings,as-built records, installation records, PTT, testing and monitoring documentation. Provision of asset management operation and maintenance report to NZTA, including Producer Statements.
Verifying Records - As-built drawings, installation record, as built records, PTT, testing results, monitoring documentation, operation and maintenance report, Producer Statements
